description: The age of the respondent at the start of the survey.

variable label: hospitalized how many family or close friends
description: hospitalized how many family or close friends
survey question:
You said that you have [NUMBER] family and close friends. Of these people, how many do you think have been
hospitalized (spent at least one night in the hospital) from the coronavirus?
answer key:
[Input number: 0-999, must be <= to total contacts and <=cr022]:
[Soft check: “Do you really know [NUMBER] people who have been hospitalized?”]

variable label: died how many family or close friends
description: died how many family or close friends
survey question:
You said that you have [NUMBER] family and close friends. Of these people, how many do you think have died
from the coronavirus?
answer key:
[Input number: 0-999, must be <= to total contacts and <= cr022]:
[Soft check: “Do you really know [NUMBER] people who have died?”]

description: The highest level of education attained by the respondent.
survey question:
What is the highest level of school that you have completed or the highest degree you
have received?
answer key:
1 Less than 1st grade
2 1st, 2nd, 3rd or 4th grade
3 5th or 6th grade
4 7th or 8th grade
5 9th grade
6 10th grade
7 11th grade
8 12th grade - no diploma
9 High school graduate - high school diploma or the equivalent (for example GED)
10 Some college but no degree
11 Associate degree in college - Occupational/vocational program
12 Associate degree in college - - Academic program
13 Bachelor’s degree (For example: BA, AB, BS)
14 Master’s degree (For example: MA, MS, MEng, MEd, MSW, MBA)
15 Professional School Degree (For example: MD,DDS,DVM,LLB,JD)
16 Doctorate degree (For example: PhD, EdD)

description: The total combined income of all members of the respondent’s household (living in their household) during the past 12 months.
survey question:
Which category represents the total combined income of all members of your family (living
in your house) during the past 12 months? This includes money from jobs, net income
from business, farm or rent, pensions, dividends, interest, Social Security payments and
any other monetary income received by members of your family who are 15 years of age
or older.

variable label: How many days in the past seven worked from home
survey question: Out of the past seven days, how many days did you work from home?

variable label: Perceived risk of death due to COVID in next 3 months
description: Perceived risk of death due to COVID in next 3 months
survey question:
If you do get the coronavirus, what is the percent chance you will die from it? If you’re not sure, please give your
best guess.

description: Indicates the race of the respondent as singular (e.g., ‘1 White’ or ‘2 Black’) or as mixed (in case the respondent identifies with two or more races). The value ‘6 Mixed’ that the respondent answered ‘Yes’ to at least two of the single race categories. This variable is generated based on the values of the different race variables (white, black, nativeamer, asian, pacific). This composite measure is not conditional on hisplatino, so an individual may identify as Hispanic or Latino, and also as a member of one or more racial groups.
survey question: Here is a list of five race categories. Please choose all that apply.
answer key:
1 White
2 Black or African American
3 American Indian or Alaska Native
4 Asian
5 Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

description: The identifier of the respondent. This identifier is assigned to a respondent at recruitment and stays with the respondent throughout each and every survey he/she participates in. When analyzing data from multiple surveys, the ‘uasid’ can be used to merge data sets.
